translations.name: La Sainte Bible
translations.description:
Augustin Crampon, canon of the Cathedral of Amiens, is a Catholic exegete and translator of the Bible which undertook the translation directly in French, of all the canonical books, from the Hebrew texts, Aramaic and Greek.
His translation of the Bible (the first volume in 1894) will go down in the history of French translations in Roman Catholicism. It appeared for the first time in a bilingual edition (Latin Vulgate / French) between 1894 and 1904 in 7 volumes. A version in one volume, in French only, in Tournai was printed in 1904 and reprinted in 1923 after a few corrections.
